citations.narrative:
Two adult dogs were seen free in the west kennel building when entered by the inspector, each having escaped from their
individual primary enclosures. The doors of these primary enclosures are kept shut by a pin or hook-and-eye mechanism
that the dogs were able to force loose. While no injuries or other concerns were apparent, dogs that are able to escape
primary enclosures are at risk of escaping the greater housing facility or may encounter other incompatible animals in the
kennel. Primary enclosures must be constructed so as to contain the dogs securely.
Correct by May 13, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two adult dogs were seen free in the west kennel building when entered by the inspector, each having escaped from their 
individual primary enclosures. The doors of these primary enclosures are kept shut by a pin or hook-and-eye mechanism 
that the dogs were able to force loose. While no injuries or other concerns were apparent, dogs that are able to escape 
primary enclosures are at risk of escaping the greater housing facility or may encounter other incompatible animals in the 
kennel. Primary enclosures must be constructed so as to contain the dogs securely. 
 
Correct by May 13, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
